values: *Flips through a book, half-heartedly making random notes here and there.* *Sighs.* *Pushes the book away and drops her quill.* Ugh. Boys! *Glances over at the Divination section despite herself.* *Scowls and stares resolutely at the book.* At least I don't have to worry about you doing anything stupid.

*Paces around her dormitory angrily.* Trying to make it out to be my fault, when he really did lie to me! *Glares at Draco's wand and necklace.* *Stuffs them into a desk drawer and locks it.* Hmph! *Scowls and stomps out of her dormitory.*

*Emerges from her dormitory and yawns.*

Mm. I needed a good rest.

*Smiles cheerfully and makes her way to the library for research.*

((Omg. Even when I'm sick, I can't keep away! D:))

*Enters the Slytherin common room nervously.*

*Looks around.*

I guess she's not here. I'll just wait. *Sits.*

*Lucretia runs up and stares at her.* Er . . . hello. Doing okay? <small>Don't tell him I'm here, okay?</small>

. . .

*Scoots away as she continues staring.*

Okay. So far I've hid in the Astronomy Tower, the Restricted Section, my dormitory . . . what's left? *Enters the school and looks around.* Slytherin. I doubt she'd go near there. *Makes her way there, trying not to smile at memories from the previous night.*

*Steps out of the kitchens with a bag of coffee.* <small>Okay. As long as I don't mention S.P.E.W., they won't kick me out.</small>

Now, where to practise? I can't use his machine again . . . <small>hope he hasn't noticed anything yet</small>.

*Looks around.*

*Heads to the Great Hall.*

Hello, Cho! I'd like to thank you so very much for that potion you made for me. I'm glad to say I'm back to normal! You are a true Ravenclaw, and I owe you so much. Really, I don't know how to repay you. If there's anything I can do, let me know, even though I don't think there's truly a way to say how thankful I am. I have enclosed a small outfit I made for your doll, however. Maybe that's a start. Um, well . . . again, thank you. So very much. Hermione P.S. Do you think you could make some more for Dean? I'm sure he'd like that.

*Sighs and heads out of the Astronomy Tower on her way to the library.*

Who would've thought? Pansy Parkinson, nice to me. *Smiles and finally pockets her handkerchief.* I really needed that. Badly.

*Steps into the library and looks around.* Empty. I hope.

*Grabs a book and heads to a quiet, isolated area.*
*Throws the door to her dormitory open.* Draco! Wake up! Now!

Hey, <lj user="imperioimperial">, you don't mind this, do you? Do you? I don't think you will. If you do, mod stick me. <s>I like it.</s>

Just announcing my friend, <lj user="7thweasley">! The new IC!Ginny! Add her! She's eager! Eager!

Yeah, shutting up now.

*Floats around idly as she talks to Crookshanks.* Thank you for delivering my letter. I don't think I can bear to go back into the school just yet. So, what have you been up to? Being the clever little darling you are, I assume! *He meows.* Yes, of course. Now, now! Don't swat at these! *Gestures at prongs.* They're very delicate at the ends! *Blinks as two letters come in.* Well, go on Crookshanks. Make sure Draco feeds you, all right? *He runs off.* *Stares at them.* Okay. Just need to get them open. . . . *Purses her lips.* *Quietly says a swear word she's heard Draco use before.*

*Floats around, chewing on a bit of kelp thoughtfully.*

This is insane. Me. A lobster. And there's photographic evidence! *Splashes a little.* Of all people to see me in this state . . . *Sighs.*

Well, at least it's dark. Can't be seen that easily now.

*Starts as the giant squid pushes her away.* All right, all right! I'll stay away from the middle of the lake! It's big enough for the both of us, you know!

*Streaks down a corridor, her pincers snapping wildly.* *Stops after what she considers to be a safe distance.* Oh, god! What was I thinking? What if--what if Draco sees me like this?! Where am I going to hide?! *Puts a pincer to her stomach.* Why do I feel like swimming? . . . I really want some clams. Or some kelp. Algae. . . . *Instinctively makes her way to the lake.*

*Steps into the Slytherin common room with Draco's clothes in her arms.*

*Spots Pansy and sneaks past her and into his dormitory and looks pleased when she discovers it's empty.*

*Puts the neatly folded clothes onto his bed and sits.* Hmm. He certainly doesn't keep things tidy . . . *Presses a few wrinkles out of his blankets and straightens them.*

Oh, I'm sure he won't mind . . . *Looks around, then cheerfully fluffs his pillows and replaces them neatly.*

And I'm sure he wouldn't mind if I straightened things out here . . . *Heads over to his desk and does a bit of reorganising.*

*Looks around again.*

I'll get it right this time, for sure! Seven's too much. Four is too much. Maybe just one this time? *Starts making a cup of coffee.*

*Tugs Draco along to Slytherin.*

Come on, before you fall asleep on the way.

Hmm. *Pulls her book closer and reads.* Looks good. *Adds another person to her very short list.* I didn't think this assignment for Muggle Studies would be so difficult. *Frowns.* *Leans back and keeps flipping through her book.* *Makes sure no one's around.* *Puts her feet on the table.* Okay, so maybe this is sort of comfortable. *Toys with her scarf as she reads.*

*Returns from Hogsmeade.*

Well, that went better than I thought it would. <s>Just wish Parkinson wasn't around.</s>

Hmm. Time for some work.

*Makes sure her scarf is in place and walks to the library.*

*Stands in front of a mirror in her dormitory.*

Hmm . . . *Adjusts her Ravenclaw scarf.* That should do it. If anyone asks, I'm just . . . cold. Very cold. <small>And I hope they'll believe it.</small>

*Steps out to go turn in her Defence Against the Dark Arts paper on harpies.*

((I don't have time for my usual, long-winded Hermione paper. I've got college essays to work on. Sorry. :p))

*Emerges from her dormitory with a slightly dopey look on her face.* *Spots letter from Cho.* Hmm? *Reads it.* *Smiles and writes a reply on the back of it.* I'd love to! Hermione. *Walks by Cho's dormitory and slips it under her door.* Speaking of letters . . . *Runs down to the common room and writes quickly.* Harry, I think it's time you taught me Quidditch. I'm ready for it anytime! Hermione *Bewitches it to find Harry and sends it off.*

*Walks away from Muggle Studies, looking a little smug.* I think I did a very good job. I don't think I forgot to mention anything, did I? *Goes over things in her brain.* Covered their history, their uses, different types, what kind of machine they are . . . *Pauses and taps chin.* Oh, maybe I should've gone over proper care and how to sharpen them! *Frowns.* Oh, well. Another time, perhaps. I doubt they'd need that sort of information, in any case, but--maybe it would've improved my grade? What if I get a bad grade for not including that? *Bites her lower lip.* Maybe I really should have included that . . . *Sighs a little and continues walking.*

*Sits up in bed suddenly and looks around groggily.* D-dungeons? *Remembers.* Oh! *Looks at the time and blinks.* Goodness, didn't know I'd slept that long. He really wasn't kidding about how comfortable his bed is. He could have woken me up, though! I missed the wedding! I really wanted to go! *Stretches and steps out of bed.* *Shivers and wraps one of his blankets around herself.* Hmm. I've never gotten a good look at the Slytherin common room. *Stretches one last time and goes to the common room.*

*Blinks as a few owls fly into her dormitory with a big package.* Hmm? Oh, I forgot! *Writes a quick thank you note to her mum and sends them off again.* *Unwraps it and pulls it out of the box.* Seems like everything's here! *Smiles.* Now to give it to him! *Makes her way to Slytherin with this in her arms.*

Okay, here we are. *Attaches first letter to the Hufflepuff entrance.* Hello, Susan! Draco told me you wanted to discuss certain things regarding a certain problem. Let me know when we can talk. I'm highly interested in comparing notes. Hermione *Attaches second letter next to the Gryffindor portrait.* Hello, Ron. I'd like to apologise for all that has happened as of late. Maybe I should've told you about this sooner. It was very wrong of me not to. I just hope in time you can forgive me. I'd hate to lose such a close friend. I would like to say this in person, however, seeing as apologising with a letter is a very cowardly thing to do. Please let me know when I can talk to you. Hermione *Bewitches another letter to find its recipient, as she has know idea where she's staying.* Hello, Rita. Just thought before you tried to spread more inane rumours, yes, Draco Malfoy and I are dating. I hope that makes you happy you horrible woman. Cheers! Hermione Granger *Returns to Ravenclaw then heads up to Cho's dormitory.* *Attaches her final letter to Cho's door.* Cho, I know I'm probably the last person you want to talk to right now, but I'd really like to talk with you. I understand if you don't want to, but please consider it. Hermione *Lets out a small sigh and sits in the common room.* I hope this helps.

*Mutters to herself.* I . . . will . . . not . . . oversleep. There! Three hundred lines!

*Holds up a long roll of parchment and looks at it.* Looks good. *Tucks it away in her backpack.*

Now that that's done, time to see which of these . . . things are defective.

*Pulls out Percy's satchel and empties the contents onto the table.*

*Stares at the plugs and outlets.*

*Stomps out to the lake.*

*Looks around.*

*Sits beneath a tree and sighs.* Must things always be so complicated?

*Opens the book she brought and begins reading.*

*Sits in her bed, pondering.* Something that doesn't seem too obvious . . . hmm. Oh! *Starts writing quickly.* Progress Report 1 - Calming Draughts -relieves stress -basic ingredients list found -analysis nearly complete -attempt to create pending; ingredients needed There. That seems innocent enough. *Runs off to find Percy.*

*Steps into the library, her eyes a little puffy.*

Well. Just because of how things are currently doesn't mean I should let up on my research. If only for him.

*Takes a breath.* Things will be fine. Just fine.

*Pulls down a book she had previously and sits to read it.*

*Opens her dormitory door just a smidgen and peeks out.*

*Opens it just a little more.*

. . .

*Shuts it and dives back into bed.*

*Walks up to the castle, looking a little flushed.*

Is there something about me that I'm not noticing? A scent or something? *Sniffs her arm curiously.* Something going around the school? *Looks around.*

. . . Bah.

*Steps up the marble staircase.*

*Briskly walks to the library, muttering to herself.*

I'm sure if we work together, we can get through the entire section and find all we need. Defence and You-Know-Who are the top priorities. Need to make notes.

*Pauses to open her bag and pulls out her pass to the Restricted Section.*

*Looks over it a few times.* Okay, everything's in order.

*Steps into the library and waits.*

*Walks out of the library carrying a few books, looking a little flustered.* Yes, I'm definitely going to need to get into the Restricted Section. *Small sigh.* Now, to find a professor. I wonder if he can sign it considering his current state . . . *Taps her chin.* Or perhaps Professor Moody? I don't think he's changed. *Wanders around.*

*Runs to her dormitory to drop off some books, then up to the Owlery.* *Scribbles a note.* Draco, I know it's odd for me to be sending you an owl when I could just be telling you this in person, but you seemed worried about that, so I'll stick with owls. Meet me near the Room of Requirement around midnight. I have something that might interest you. Hermione *Attaches it to the owl's leg and watches it fly off.* Good then. A nice start, I think.

*Walks through corridors, looking slightly jumpy.*

Maybe I'll just stay in the dormitories or the common room . . . no, probably not a good idea. Maybe she didn't notice that bit?

*Frowns.*

I think I'll just stay in the library.

*Walks there and hides behind a few stacks of books again.*

*Smiles smugly.* Harry, I believe you'll be teaching me Quidditch soon! But . . . not just yet. *Runs to the library and surrounds herself with a pile of books.* Never. Again. *Opens a book and starts reading, sighing happily.*

*Paces around in the library, looking over a sheet of parchment.*

Hmm. Maybe I should reword that sentence. A synonym for that would be a good idea, I think. Hmm . . . oh, I can't concentrate with all this sadness floating around the castle!

*Slumps into a chair and looks around.*

*Spots a book and jumps up.* Oh, I don't think I've read this one before! *Grabs it.*

I'm sure it doesn't count if I just . . . read the back cover. *Ducks out of sight and does so.*

I'm sure it's a good read; it has to be! *Looks around and opens it a little.*

No! No! Self-control! *Snaps it shut.* <small>I'll come back for you.</small>

. . .

*Gives the book a little hug.*

*Walks into the common room, looking somewhat pleased and frustrated.*

Just a warning for Harry, Draco, Cho, and possibly Ginny. Skeeter's coming.

Be prepared.

I think I'll go read a book--er, work on my paper.

Day two of going without books has gone well! I had a very small moment of weakness last night, but I quickly stamped it out. I have lots of self-control. Plenty!

Now, um. This Defence Against the Dark Arts assignment. *Stares down at the name.*

At least it doesn't require a book.

Day one of the bet has gone quite well!

Yes, I bet Harry that I could go a week without reading, in case you haven't already heard. I've had no urges whatsoever to read, no matter what anyone may tell you. Like I told Draco, I'm quite confident that I can do this, and I'm sure it'll strengthen my character very much! My appreciation for books will most likely double, too!

*Takes a breath and smiles.*

I can do this!
Um, Harry? If you don't mind, I'd like word.

*Walks into the common room, looking a bit dishevelled.* Well, of all the nerve, pushing me out like that! *Exhales sharply and crosses her arms.* Just as a note, whatever you do, avoid that Rita Skeeter if you possibly can!

Well, that was easier than I thought! I hope she puts that book to good use <s>and loses the bet</s>.

*Sinks into an armchair.* Working at Sirius' bar. What was I thinking?

Oh, don't give me that look, Rosencrantz! Go back to your book!

I wonder how the Rons are doing . . .

I'm still Head Girl, right? *Looks down at her badge.* Yes, I think so. Yes.

Therefore, I think I'll use my power for good! I want everyone to read to their bears, especially if you haven't already! I think it'll be good for them! *Smiles.* I mean, look at my ickle Rossy--already reading Shakespeare!

Well, if you need any books, I have plenty!

Oh, and Draco. *Clears throat.* Found a rather . . . *Searches for a good word.* . . . inappropriate picture. Would like to return it whenever possible, seeing as I think Rosencrantz doesn't need it!

*Glares at him.* Hey! Don't pull Crookshanks' tail!

I'm afraid I didn't do my Defence Against the Dark Arts assignment. I have . . . *Clears throat.* I have more important things to get done. Extra credit, you know! 

Come, Rossy! I've got some more books for you!

*Runs into her dormitory, beckoning Rosencrantz along, then shuts the door.*

So, is everyone's bear project going just fine? I know mine is! *Rosencrantz, in a tiny top hat and tuxedo, looks up from his copy of One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish in a slightly pompous manner.* See? I've got him reading! I figured he'd like that book because it's about fish, and bears eat fish, don't they? I can only assume that since he's a teddy bear, he'd have bear-like instincts, don't you think? Ohh! He's turning out to be such a proper bear! *Smiles proudly at him as he sips a cup of tea.* You're such a good little bear, aren't you ickle Rossy? *Leans in to kiss him, only to get bonked by a bat.* No, Rossy! Remember what Mumsy told you? You channel that negative energy into more useful things! Do you hear me? Chaaannel! *He ponders this, then looks up at her and says, "Rannel?"* You can talk now? Oh, Mumsy is so proud! So, so proud! I think you've graduated to Green Eggs and Ham! That one is one of my favourites!

Okay, um, I'm afraid I've been acting a little odd the past few days. A lot of pent up stress caused it, I suppose, so if I said anything at all funny, you'll have to forgive me. Now, to start on these assignments! I think I'll be a bit rebellious and do my Defence Against the Dark Arts one later, so all that's left is--PUT THAT DOWN! *Yanks the bear away from her Ancient Runes textbook.* Bad bear! Bad! Very ba--don't rip the pages! *Grabs it again and glares.* Awful, aren't you? Well. Let me think of a name for you. How about . . . Rosencrantz? Yes, that will fit. *Rosencrantz smiles and looks all cute and innocent.* Aww! Just needed a name, and already a darling! Mumsy loves you! *Hugs him.* *Jumps back after getting hit in the head with his little bat.* Oh, just don't know your own strength, do you? You've got to be more careful, ickle Rossy, or else you'll hurt your Mumsy! *Makes to pat his head, but pulls her hand away before it can be bitten.* Aww, just a little touchy, aren't you? You're a lovely little bear, and Mumsy's going to make sure you get civilised! Let's go meet some other bears, Rossy!
*Sighs as she reads through her letter from Draco.* Oh, now he wants to take account of my feelings? Lovely timing! *Crosses her arms.* I'm not satisfied.

*Hums placidly.*

It's such a good day, don't you think?
